page.title: 01Upton Snodsbury Area.
page.content: This area of central Worcestershire lies mainly south of the A422 Worcester to Stratford-upon-Avon Road and consists almost entirely of agricultural land with 4 small centres of population. The largest village, Upton Snodsbury (pop.350) is 9 miles east of Worcester and 19 miles from Stratford on the southern side of the A422. Broughton Hackett, 1 mile west is on the northern side of A422. The hamlets of Churchill (pop.100) and White Ladies Aston (pop.150) are on a minor road running south from Broughton Hackett. The B.4082 road runs south from Upton Snodsbury to Pershore, which is one of the administrative centres for Wychavon District Council, in whose local authority the area lies. The Bow Brook, a tributary of the river Avon flows through the centre of the area.
